refnamediv.refpurpose: a text entry field with a dropdown list.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkCombo widget consists of a single-line text entry field and a drop-down list. The drop-down list is displayed when the user clicks on a small arrow button to the right of the entry field.

The drop-down list is a GtkList widget and can be accessed using the list member of the GtkCombo-struct. List elements can contain arbitrary widgets, but if an element is not a plain label, then you must use the gtk_list_set_item_string() function. This sets the string which will be placed in the text entry field when the item is selected.
By default, the user can step through the items in the list using the arrow (cursor) keys, though this behaviour can be turned off with gtk_combo_set_use_arrows().
As of GTK+ 2.4, GtkCombo has been deprecated in favor of GtkComboBox.

refsect2.title: struct GtkCombo

warning.para: GtkCombo is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: The GtkFixedChild-struct struct contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be set by an application.)

listitem.simpara: the list shown in the drop-down window.

warning.para: gtk_combo_new is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_set_popdown_strings ()

warning.para: gtk_combo_set_popdown_strings is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: Convenience function to set all of the items in the popup list. (See the example above.)

listitem.simpara: a list of strings, or NULL to clear the popup list

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_set_value_in_list ()

warning.para: gtk_combo_set_value_in_list is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: Specifies whether the value entered in the text entry field must match one of the values in the list. If this is set then the user will not be able to perform any other action until a valid value has been entered.
If an empty field is acceptable, the ok_if_empty parameter should be TRUE.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the value entered must match one of the values in the list.
TRUE if an empty value is considered valid.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_set_use_arrows ()

warning.para: gtk_combo_set_use_arrows is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: Specifies if the arrow (cursor) keys can be used to step through the items in the list. This is on by default.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the arrow keys can be used to step through the items in the list.

warning.para: gtk_combo_set_use_arrows_always is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_set_case_sensitive ()

warning.para: gtk_combo_set_case_sensitive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: Specifies whether the text entered into the GtkEntry field and the text in the list items is case sensitive.
This may be useful, for example, when you have called gtk_combo_set_value_in_list() to limit the values entered, but you are not worried about differences in case.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the text in the list items is case sensitive.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_set_item_string ()

warning.para: gtk_combo_set_item_string is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: Sets the string to place in the GtkEntry field when a particular list item is selected. This is needed if the list item is not a simple label.

listitem.simpara: the string to place in the GtkEntry when item is selected.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_disable_activate ()

warning.para: gtk_combo_disable_activate is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use GtkComboBox instead.

refsect2.para: Stops the GtkCombo widget from showing the popup list when the GtkEntry emits the "activate" signal, i.e. when the Return key is pressed. This may be useful if, for example, you want the Return key to close a dialog instead.

listitem.para: Whether an empty value may be entered in this field.
Whether list item matching is case sensitive.
Whether the arrow keys move through the list of items.
Whether entered values must already be present in the list.
